text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <SELLER>Bey Herrn Daniel Hag dem Buchbinder</SELLER>
  <INTRO>Sind folgende Bücher, in nachgesetztem Preis zu verkauffen;</INTRO>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Justi Lipsii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Epistolarum Centuriae complet</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT>
    <IMPRINT>apud Plautin.</IMPRINT>
    <PRICE>1. Gulden 36. xr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Politicorum Libri</TITLE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Monita</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>8e Exempla politica</VOLUME>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>De Magnitudine Romana</TITLE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>De Constantia</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT>
    <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT>
    <PRICE>fl. 1. xr. 36.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>De Militia Romana cum An. fig.</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>
    <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT>
    <PRICE>fl. 1. xr. 30.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Poliorecticon de Machinis, Tormentis, Telis cum An. fig.</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT>
    <PRICE>fl. 1. xr. 12.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>De Amphitheatro</TITLE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>De Amphitheatris extra Romam, cum An. fig.</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>
    <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT>
    <PRICE>30. xr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Dissert. apud Principes Se C. Plinii Panegyricus cum Commentar.</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>
    <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT>
    <PRICE>48. xr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>C. Corn. Taciti & Velleji Paterculi</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Opera cum Lipsii Commentariis</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>Fol.</FORMAT>
    <NOTE>gros</NOTE>
    <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT>
    <PRICE>fl. 3.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Ovidii</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Opera cum Notis Integris W. Heinsii & variorum</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <VOLUME>3. Theil</VOLUME>
    <PLACE>Lugd.</PLACE>
    <PRICE>fl. 7. xr. 12.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Gotthard Heideggers</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Kleinere Teutsche Schrifften</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1732</YEAR>
    <PRICE>30. xr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Delicia Urbis Bernae</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1732</YEAR>
    <PRICE>13. kr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>J. J. Scheuchzers</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Vernunfft-mässige Undersuchung des Baades zu Baaden, mit Kupfferen</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1732</YEAR>
    <PRICE>11. kr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>J. J. Scheuchzers</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Vernunfft-mässige Undersuchung des Baades zu Baaden, ohne Kupffer</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>4to.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1732</YEAR>
    <PRICE>4. Batzen.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>Johann Milton</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>Verlust des Paradieses</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1732</YEAR>
    <PRICE>14. kr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Paragone della Poesia Tragica d'Italia con quella di Francia</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1732</YEAR>
    <PRICE>5. Batzen.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <AUTHOR>J. J. Breitingeri</AUTHOR>
    <TITLE>In Versus obscurciss. Persii diatribe Historico-Literaria</TITLE>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1723</YEAR>
    <PRICE>1. Batzen.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Discurse der Mahleren</TITLE>
    <VOLUME>4. Theil</VOLUME>
    <FORMAT>8vo.</FORMAT>
    <YEAR>1731</YEAR>
    <PRICE>16. kr.</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":18,"explanation":"1) Wrapped the introductory prose in <SELLER> and <INTRO> tags to avoid free text directly under <ITEM>.
2) Closed an unclosed <BIBL> after “Politicorum Libri” and moved subsequent titles into their own <BIBL> blocks.
3) Split the nested BIBL structure around “Monita / 8e Exempla politica” into a single coherent <BIBL> with <TITLE> and <VOLUME>.
4) Created a separate <BIBL> for “De Magnirudine Romana” and corrected the title to “De Magnitudine Romana”.
5) Added <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> where “ibid.” clearly refers to the place/printer, instead of leaving it as bare text.
6) Normalized the price tag name from mixed <PRIZE>/<PRICE> to a consistent <PRICE> element throughout.
7) Added an <IMPRINT> element for “apud Plautin.” instead of leaving it as untagged text.
8) Escaped ampersands in author strings as & to make the XML well-formed.
9) Removed stray hyphens that were joining <FORMAT> with following text (e.g. “<FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>-ibid.”) and placed “ibid.” into <IMPRINT>.
10) Separated “De Amphitheatro” and “De Amphitheatris extra Romam…” into two distinct <BIBL> entries instead of nested, invalid BIBL-in-BIBL markup.
11) Added a <NOTE>gros</NOTE> to capture “groß” (here “gro�fc”) as a descriptor for the folio format instead of leaving it as malformed text.
12) Removed trailing full stops from <YEAR> values to keep them numeric and more machine-usable (1732. → 1732).
13) Regularized the currency abbreviation represented by garbled “�fc” into “kr.” (Kreuzer) where context indicates small coin units.
14) Corrected obvious OCR/encoding errors in several titles (e.g. “Parabieses” → “Paradieses”; “Pobsia Tragica dtalia conquella di Francia” → “Poesia Tragica d'Italia con quella di Francia”; “diarribe” → “diatribe”; “Vernunfft-m�a7�fcige” → “Vernunfft-mässige”).
15) Added missing <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> to some Lipsius-related BIBL entries where the author is clearly the same but was omitted in the original nested structure.
16) Ensured each <BIBL> contains only one logical bibliographic item, avoiding nested <BIBL> tags inside another <BIBL>.
17) Indented and line-broke the XML for readability while keeping it structurally equivalent.
18) Verified all tags are properly opened/closed so the result is well-formed XML.

Note: The key in your request was 'number_of_fixes'; I used 'number_of_corrections' to stay consistent with the provided response schema, but the value corresponds to the total structural/content fixes applied."}

parsed.explanation:
1) Wrapped the introductory prose in <SELLER> and <INTRO> tags to avoid free text directly under <ITEM>.
2) Closed an unclosed <BIBL> after “Politicorum Libri” and moved subsequent titles into their own <BIBL> blocks.
3) Split the nested BIBL structure around “Monita / 8e Exempla politica” into a single coherent <BIBL> with <TITLE> and <VOLUME>.
4) Created a separate <BIBL> for “De Magnirudine Romana” and corrected the title to “De Magnitudine Romana”.
5) Added <IMPRINT>ibid.</IMPRINT> where “ibid.” clearly refers to the place/printer, instead of leaving it as bare text.
6) Normalized the price tag name from mixed <PRIZE>/<PRICE> to a consistent <PRICE> element throughout.
7) Added an <IMPRINT> element for “apud Plautin.” instead of leaving it as untagged text.
8) Escaped ampersands in author strings as & to make the XML well-formed.
9) Removed stray hyphens that were joining <FORMAT> with following text (e.g. “<FORMAT>4to</FORMAT>-ibid.”) and placed “ibid.” into <IMPRINT>.
10) Separated “De Amphitheatro” and “De Amphitheatris extra Romam…” into two distinct <BIBL> entries instead of nested, invalid BIBL-in-BIBL markup.
11) Added a <NOTE>gros</NOTE> to capture “groß” (here “gro�fc”) as a descriptor for the folio format instead of leaving it as malformed text.
12) Removed trailing full stops from <YEAR> values to keep them numeric and more machine-usable (1732. → 1732).
13) Regularized the currency abbreviation represented by garbled “�fc” into “kr.” (Kreuzer) where context indicates small coin units.
14) Corrected obvious OCR/encoding errors in several titles (e.g. “Parabieses” → “Paradieses”; “Pobsia Tragica dtalia conquella di Francia” → “Poesia Tragica d'Italia con quella di Francia”; “diarribe” → “diatribe”; “Vernunfft-m�a7�fcige” → “Vernunfft-mässige”).
15) Added missing <AUTHOR>Ejusd.</AUTHOR> to some Lipsius-related BIBL entries where the author is clearly the same but was omitted in the original nested structure.
16) Ensured each <BIBL> contains only one logical bibliographic item, avoiding nested <BIBL> tags inside another <BIBL>.
17) Indented and line-broke the XML for readability while keeping it structurally equivalent.
18) Verified all tags are properly opened/closed so the result is well-formed XML.

Note: The key in your request was 'number_of_fixes'; I used 'number_of_corrections' to stay consistent with the provided response schema, but the value corresponds to the total structural/content fixes applied.
